\n \n%c[0,170,170,170]An unknown weapon, the firing mechanism of which has not been established. The weapon appears faulty - squeezing the trigger doesn't do anything. It's very heavy and definitely high-tech. Of note is that it appears not to fire bullets based on ignition. Most probably, the rounds are propelled by electro-magnetic forces using Gauss gun principle. Should be brought back for military evaluation.

%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Main characteristic and advantages: %c[0,170,170,170]High magazine capacity. SA/DA trigger provides higher practical accuracy. High reliability. %c[0,140,140,140] 
 
%c[0,170,170,170]USP is a semi-automatic pistol developed in Germany by Heckler and Koch as a replacement for older HK P7 pistol. The USP was developed with US law enforcement market in mind, later also incorporating USSOCOM requirements (the outcome was Mk.23 pistol). The USP was originally built around the .40SW cartridge, but a 9x19mm Parabellum variant was introduced at the same time, later on, .45ACP variant was also offered. Several variants of USP are offered apart from standard version, among them Compact, Tactical (standard variant with threaded barrel) and Match (long, match barrel for higher accuracy in target shooting). All USP pistols are built to withstand more powerful +P rounds, so they have long service life. USP pistols are short-recoil operated, locked-breech handguns with a polymer frame. The barrel is locked to the slide by a single lug. All USP variants barrels have polygonal rifling. DA/SA trigger can be easily swapped and replaced by various other triggers, depending on shooter's needs. The recoil spring has additional buffer to reduce the felt recoil. Designed primarily to buffer the slide and barrel and reduce recoil effects on the pistol components, the system also lowers the recoil forces felt by the shooter up to 30%. Major metal components of USP pistols are all coated with nitride finish to provide extreme corrosion resistance. USP pistols were tested in harsh environments and extreme temperatures. They are widely considered to be one of the most reliable and dependable modern combat handguns. German army, Bundeswehr, uses modified USP variant under P8 designation. USP variants were adopted by many armies, counter-terrorist groups and law enforcement agencies, they are also popular among civilian gun owners. In The Zone, USP pistols are one of the most common sidearms of various PMC groups. Free stalkers of all faction also like these pistols and they are widely considered top of the shelf. Their high capacity and reliability, even in harsh anomalous zones, make USP a perfect choice for a sidearm.

All USP pistols are built to withstand more powerful +P rounds, so they have long service life. USP pistols are short-recoil operated, locked-breech handguns with a polymer frame. The barrel is locked to the slide by a single lug. All USP variants barrels have polygonal rifling. DA/SA trigger can be easily swapped and replaced by various other triggers, depending on shooter's needs. The recoil spring has additional buffer to reduce the felt recoil. Designed primarily to buffer the slide and barrel and reduce recoil effects on the pistol components, the system also lowers the recoil forces felt by the shooter up to 30%. Major metal components of USP pistols are all coated with nitride finish to provide extreme corrosion resistance. USP pistols were tested in harsh environments and extreme temperatures. They are widely considered to be one of the most reliable and dependable modern combat handguns. German army, Bundeswehr, uses modified USP variant under P8 designation. USP variants were adopted by many armies, counter-terrorist groups and law enforcement agencies, they are also popular among civilian gun owners. In The Zone, USP pistols are one of the most common sidearms of various PMC groups. Free stalkers of all faction also like these pistols and they are widely considered top of the shelf. Their high capacity and reliability, even in harsh anomalous zones, make USP a perfect choice for a sidearm.

%c[0,170,170,170]HK45 is a .45 caliber semi-automatic pistol developed in Germany by Heckler and Koch for U.S. Military Joint Combat Pistol program, which was intended to emerge a replacement pistol for aging Beretta M9. The program was shut down and M9 remained in service until 2017, but nonetheless the HK45 and it's 9x19mm counterpart, the HK P30 entered civilian and law enforcement market, becoming successful successors to USP pistol. HK45 in itself is an evolution of USP. Internal operating mechanism remains the same - HK45 is short-recoil operated, locked-breech handgun with polymer frame. Slide is designed for maximum durability, it is made of metal with protective coating. Front of the barrel is fitted with rubber ring which improves barrel-to-slide fit and enhances accuracy. Recoil system features an additional polymer buffer which decreases stress on the frame and reduces felt recoil. Trigger is of modular design, available in several versions. The biggest step forward was in terms of ergonomics. The frame, made of impact-resistant polymer, is specially designed to perfectly fit shooter's hand, it also has specially textured to improve the grip when the gun is wet. HK45 and pistols which share it's design are widely considered to have ones of the most comfortable pistol grips among those currently available on market. The newer grip and interchangeable backstraps allow the pistol to sit lower into the web of the hand, contributing to better control of the weapon and recoil management. However, in order to accomodate this smaller grip, the magazine capacity was lowered from 12 to 10. Overally, the HK45 and P30 pistols are one of the most advanced combat handguns currently available. In The Zone, these pistols are sometimes used by various mercenary groups, as well as special forces operators, foreign expeditions security and various free stalkers who value it's high reliability, ergonomics and effectiveness, despite it's high price compared to other modern 9x19mm pistols.

%c[0,170,170,170]VSS Vintorez is a Soviet integrally suppressed rifle chambered in subsonic 9x39mm cartridge developed for special operations. It's integral silencer coupled with specially designed subsonic ammunition provides very high level of sound reduction, which makes it one of the quietest weapons in the entire world. It's accurized barrel, improved ergonomics and crisp trigger were specially designed for precision shooting on distances up to 300 meters, which makes perfect use of 9x39mm ammunition's advantages. VSS Vintorez ("Thread cutter") is an integrally suppressed sniper rifle which was developed in 1980s in Soviet Union as a weapon intended for use in special forces operations and secret police. Before that, the only weapons of Spetsnaz that could be used in stealth operations were AK and AKM rifles fitted with silencers and using heavier, subsonic variant of 7.62x39mm ammunition. It was not nearly enough - subsonic 7.62mm ammunition lost a lot of energy, which meant unfavorable range, accuracy and terminal ballistics, not to mention problems with jamming (this ammunition was weaker and couldn't cycle the gas system). That's why new cartridge, the 9x39mm, was developed, and so were new weapons: AS Val and VSS Vintorez. The new weapons were gas operated, selective fire assault rifles. They used significantly modified AK system. AS and VSS became adopted in 1987 and are used in small numbers by FSB (formerly KGB), MVD, OMON, GRU and Spetsnaz units. While both AS Val and VSS were adopted, only the latter found wider use in Soviet and Russian units. Of the two rifles, Vintorez was found to be more useful and can be seen more often in hands of Russian operatives. Limited numbers of VSS rifles are known to be used by Ukrainian military and Exclusion Zone Crisis Management forces as weapons for use by squads of Spetsnaz and USS for special operations in areas of Chernobyl and Pripyat. These weapons were also found in hands of stalkers and mercenaries in The Zone, which could mean that either the black market dealers or the mercenaries and private military contractors have ties with Russian Federation government and military.

%c[0,170,170,170]9A-91 is an assault rifle chambered in 9x39mm ammunition, designed as a competitor and cheaper alternative to SR-3 Vikhr assault rifle. It's distinctive features are simplified construction, lack of integral suppressor and a crude folding stock. It's quality is not as high as of Val or VSS rifles, but it is significantly cheaper and still remains an effective weapon. It is a 9x39mm rifle that was intended to be a part of weapon family named A91, which was designed to also contain rifles chambered in calibers 7.62x39mm, 5.45x39mm and 5.56x45mm. Since these three chamberings didn't gain interest of Russian government, only 9x39mm project came to life. It was at first intended to be introduced to military as a personal defense weapon (PDW), but instead it became weapon for various government organizations and law enforcement agencies as a cheaper alternative to Vikhr assault rifle. 9A-91 is slightly different from AS Val and SR-3; it is made using stamped steel parts, which are less durable, but way cheaper and quicker to produce, all parts and furniture are very simplified and crudely made. It's a gas operated firearm which utilizes a long stroke gas piston and a rotating bolt, based on the AK system, just like Val. 9A-91 was a base to VSK-94 "para-sniper" rifle.

%c[0,170,170,170]SR-3M Vikhr is a Russian assault rifle chambered in 9x39mm ammunition. It is designed for FSB, most notably the Presidential Security Service (SBP), as a powerful PDW-type weapon that can be concealed and quickly taken out for use with devastating firepower. It has high rate of fire and uses a 9x39mm cartridge which provide good terminal ballistics, it's drawbacks however are very limited range and accuracy, it also lacks an integral silencer like AS Val. It was designed as a compact weapon for use as a personal defense weapon (PDW) for Russia's federal government security agencies, most notably FSB together with it's secret services like Presidential Security Service (SBP), which is tasked with protecting the president of Russia. Just like Val, it was also an expensive weapon and wasn't produced in big numbers. It was used mostly with government agencies, as military lost interest in this, mainly because it wasn't possible to mass produce it quickly, but also because VSS rifles fit them best. SR-3 was designed as a shortened variant of AS Val rifle, without it's internal suppressor. SR-3M rifles can be very rarely seen in The Zone, it is rumored that Private Military Companies (Mercs) who have ties with Russia received few of them as support, but it's not confirmed.

%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Main characteristic and advantages: %c[0,170,170,170]Universal striker-fired design. High magazine capacity. Highly ergonomic grip. Pre-set trigger noticeably lowers practical accuracy. %c[0,140,140,140] 
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Walther P99 is a modern semi-automatic pistol developed by Carl Walther GmbH in the late 1990s for law enforcement. It is one of the most successful polymer-framed, striker fired pistols chambered in 9x19mm cartridge. Walther P99 is a short recoil-operated locked breech semi-automatic pistol that uses a modified Browning cam-lock system adapted from the Hi-Power pistol. The P99 has a glassfiber-reinforced polymer frame and steel slide assembly. It can be broken down into its main parts or field stripped with a take down catch without the help of tools. It uses an internal striker as opposed to an external hammer, with a red-painted striker tip that protrudes from rear of the slide when the gun is cocked, as well as a loaded chamber indicator on the right side of the slide. P99 comes in several variants with different triggers, mainly DA, DAO and AS. Since this pistol is produced for police and law enforcement, the trigger pull is long and heavy - it is intentional feature to reduce chances of negligent discharge. Because of this, some shooters modify the triggers of P99 to improve practical accuracy. P99 is very light and has very good, ergonomic grip, widely considered to be one of the most comfortable among all modern pistols. Magazine holds 15 rounds. P99 is closest in comparison to Glock 19 pistol, with which it shares the capacity and striker-fired construction. Glock is usually considered better designed for military use, while P99 is considered to be a typical police pistol. Both of these weapons are good and the choice usually comes down to personal preference. P99 is widely used around the world and is one of the most common pistols in Europe, most notably used by police departments in Germany and Poland, and also SBU in Ukraine. In The Zone, P99 pistols are one of the most popular handguns together with Glock, PM and CZ-75 pistols. They usually come from civilian market or are smuggled in by arms dealers. Just like Glocks, they are very common and well liked by stalkers of all professions for their high reliability, high magazine capacity and 9x19mm round, which is more effective than old 9x18mm Makarov cartridge.

%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Main characteristic and advantages: %c[0,170,170,170]Low-end, cheaper variant shotgun. Pump-action shotgun. Rate of fire limited by manual operation. High damage. Best on short range. %c[0,140,140,140] 
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Mossberg Maverick 88 is an American pump-action shotgun designed as a cheaper, economy class variant of the famous Mossberg 500 shotgun. The Maverick line of shotguns is assembled in Eagle Pass, Texas, using some parts manufactured outside of the United States, mainly from Mexico, which contributes to their relatively lower price in comparison to the Mossberg 500 series of shotguns. Maverick 88s are factory finished with steel bluing only, whereas Mossberg 500s have factory-blued, nickel-plated or parkerized (barrel/magazine) options. Apart from that, they are basically identical to Mossberg 500. Mossberg shotguns are popular in law enforcement agencies and police departments, as well as among civilian gun owners and hunters. They are regarded as high-quality weapons that are dependable and of high quality. These shotguns utilize pump action, which is operated by a sliding forend. The forend is connected with the bolt group. The receiver is produced from lightweight aluminum alloy. Ammunition is fed from the tubular magazine that is located under the barrel. Pump action shotguns are popular in both the USA and Europe, and some stalkers brought these weapons, often legally owned, along with them into The Zone, where they are primarily used for defense against wild animals and mutants or hunting them. Like all other shotguns, the Maverick is liked for the sheer power that the 12 gauge shells provide.

%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Main characteristic and advantages: %c[0,170,170,170]Low-end, cheaper variant shotgun. Pump-action shotgun. Rate of fire limited by manual operation. High damage. Best on short range. %c[0,140,140,140] 
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Mossberg Maverick 88 is an American pump-action shotgun designed as a cheaper, economy class variant of the famous Mossberg 500 shotgun. The Maverick line of shotguns is assembled in Eagle Pass, Texas, using some parts manufactured outside of the United States, mainly from Mexico, which contributes to their relatively lower price in comparison to the Mossberg 500 series of shotguns. Maverick 88s are factory finished with steel bluing only, whereas Mossberg 500s have factory-blued, nickel-plated or parkerized (barrel/magazine) options. Apart from that, they are basically identical to Mossberg 500. Mossberg shotguns are popular in law enforcement agencies and police departments, as well as among civilian gun owners and hunters. They are regarded as high-quality weapons that are dependable and of high quality. These shotguns utilize pump action, which is operated by a sliding forend. The forend is connected with the bolt group. The receiver is produced from lightweight aluminum alloy. Ammunition is fed from the tubular magazine that is located under the barrel. Pump action shotguns are popular in both the USA and Europe, and some stalkers brought these weapons, often legally owned, along with them into The Zone, where they are primarily used for defense against wild animals and mutants or hunting them. Like all other shotguns, the Maverick is liked for the sheer power that the 12 gauge shells provide.

%c[0,170,170,170]The Winchester Model 1894 rifle (also known as the Winchester 94 or Model 94) is a lever-action repeating rifle designed by John Browning in 1894. It was the first rifle to chamber the smokeless powder round, the .30 WCF (Winchester Center Fire, in time becoming known as the .30-30) in 1895. The Model 94's combination of potent firepower in a compact, lightweight, comfortable-to-carry, and quick-shooting package has made it an extremely popular hunting rifle, particularly for white-tailed deer in the dense forests of the Eastern United States, where most game is killed at relatively short distances. As a result, it was the first sporting rifle to sell over 7,000,000 units. The Model 1894 has been referred to as the "ultimate lever-action design" by firearms historians such as R. L. Wilson and Hal Herring. The Model 1894 is the rifle credited with the name "Winchester" being used to refer to all rifles of this type and was the first commercial sporting rifle to sell over 7,000,000 units. Overally, the M1894 is a light, accurate and effective lever-action rifle. .44 Magnum chambering has good terminal ballistics, further pushed due to longer barrel, but also has way less recoil than revolvers chambered in this round as added weight and improved ergonomics of rifle make it much easier to control. Becuase of this, it's a very good hunting and sporting weapon. Some of these rifles were used by USA, Great Britain and France during the WWI. Lever-action rifles were never very popular in Europe and it is unknown how this weapon reached The Zone. Since it's a very good hunting rifle, it might have been used by some eccentric mutant hunter who favored the .44 Magnum load.

%c[0,170,170,170]IZh-43 is a low-end Soviet SxS shotgun. This specimen is a field modification, manufactured by Zone technician specially for use against mutants. In place of standard 12-gauge or 16-gauge barrels, 23mm rifled barrels are used, like in KS-23 shotguns. Uses special 23mm shotgun shells (23x75mm), shared with KS-23. While this shotgun is not as effective shooting buckshot shells, it can shoot specially designed slugs with high accuracy, sending powerful 23mm projectiles down range with immense power. Whether more such modifications were made is unknown.

%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Main characteristic and advantages: %c[0,170,170,170]Designed for maximum reliability. Low recoil. Can place follow-up shots reliably and quickly. Moderate damage output. Best on medium range. %c[0,140,140,140] 
 
%c[0,170,170,170]AKS-74 is a folding-stock variant of AK-74, a Soviet 5.45x39mm assault rifle that was designed in early 1970s as an answer to new US M16 rifle shooting new type of ammunition. Use of new, smaller cartridge increases accuracy and range and makes it much easier to take follow up shots with it, which increases the chances of hitting - all this while retaining durability and reliability of other AK rifles. AK-74 and it's variants still stay as service rifle of Ukrainian military and is one of the most popular weapons in The Zone due to it's reliability, accuracy, low price and readily available ammunition. Mechanically, it's a gas operated, selective fire assault rifle. The gas operated action has a massive bolt carrier with a permanently attached long stroke gas piston. The bolt carrier moves on the two rails with visible clearances between the parts, which allows the gun to operate even when it's interior is severely fouled with sand or mud. Overengineered receiver and chrome lined barrel provide exceptional durability, and the well-designed cartridge dimensions and strong action allow for reliable feeding in almost all conditions, even when the weapon is very dirty and/or corroded. Among main features of AKS-74 are the chambering in lighter and more accurate 5.45x39mm round and a new muzzle device, which further reduces the recoil, muzzle climb and the flash from firing, together with new type of stock which folds to the side. Furniture is slightly redesigned from AKM, early AK-74s used plywood furniture like AKM but big amount was also produced with dark-plum coloured polymer stock and handguards, which is more resistant to wear and slightly lighter than plywood. AK-74 and it's variants stay in service in more than 20 countries. AKS-74 also still stays as service rifle of Ukrainian military and is one of the most popular weapons in The Zone due to it's reliability, accuracy, low price and readily available ammunition. Lots of these rifles were stolen from military warehouses or bought off from corrupt military officials. Stalkers like AKS-74's folding stock as it is more compact, making it easier to carry.

%c[0,170,170,170]AKS-74u (also known as Ksyuha, Suchka or Okurok, or Krinkov in USA) is a commando-length carbine variant of AK-74 rifle. It was developed around the time of AK-74's adoption and was intended as a personal defense weapon for vehicles' crews, helicopter pilots, special forces operators and personnel that didn't need long rifles or had trouble carrying one. It is way shorter than typical infantry rifle and is even slightly shorter than comparable weapons of it's era like XM177 or HK53. Mechanically, it's a gas operated, selective fire assault rifle. The gas operated action has a massive bolt carrier with a permanently attached long stroke gas piston. It uses AK-74 gas action, but due to problems with insufficient pressure from shorter barrel, a special gas system was designed for it. Other differences from AK-74 are new, simplified rear sight, shorter handguard and side-folding stock mounted by default. In tactical sense it's something between a carbine and submachine gun - it has a 206mm (8") long barrel and a folding stock, which makes it lighter and way more maneuverable in close quarters than long AK-74 rifle. It's a controversial weapon - on one hand, it is light and compact, and due to better maneuverability and higher rate of fire it is more effective in close quarters than a rifle, on the other, it has higher recoil than submachine gun, it's accurate only to about 100-150 meters and it overheats quickly. It is praised by some and hated by others. It became a popular weapon in The Zone for those stalkers who don't participate in fights but need something to defend themselves from mutants and bandits, and don't want a long and heavy rifle that would reduce the amount of loot they could carry due to it's weight and size.

%c[0,170,170,170]Designed by Magnum Research, US, the Desert Eagle uses a gas-operated mechanism normally found in rifles. This allows the pistol to use far more powerful rounds than traditional semi-automatic pistol designs. The drawback to this weapon is its size and weight. For reason unknown all Desert Eagle units found within Exclusion Zone are chambered with .357 Magnum rounds.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]ATTACHMENTS:
 
%c[0,204,0,51] • %c[0,204,0,51] mounting silencer not possible

\n \n%c[0,170,170,170]The ruggedness, simplicity, low cost, and effectiveness of the RPG-7 has made it the most widely used anti-armor weapon in the world. Currently around 40 countries use the weapon, and it is manufactured in a number of variants by nine countries.

%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Main characteristic and advantages: %c[0,170,170,170]Moderate recoil. Can place follow-up shots reliably. Special subsonic ammunition allows for very effective sound suppression and good damage output. Best on close range. %c[0,140,140,140] 
 
%c[0,170,170,170]AS Val is a Soviet integrally suppressed rifle chambered in subsonic 9x39mm cartridge developed for special operations. It's integral silencer coupled with specially designed subsonic ammunition provides very high level of sound reduction, which makes it one of the quietest weapons in the entire world. AS Val (Russian: "Shaft") is an integrally suppressed weapon which was developed in 1980s in Soviet Union as a weapon intended for use in special forces operations and secret police. Before that, the only weapons of Spetsnaz that could be used in stealth operations were AK and AKM rifles fitted with silencers and using heavier, subsonic variant of 7.62x39mm ammunition. It was not nearly enough - subsonic 7.62mm ammunition lost a lot of energy, which meant unfavorable range, accuracy and terminal ballistics, not to mention problems with jamming (this ammunition was weaker and couldn't cycle the gas system). That's why new cartridge, the 9x39mm, was developed, and so were new weapons: AS Val and VSS Vintorez. The new weapons were gas operated, selective fire assault rifles. They used significantly modified AK system. AS and VSS became adopted in 1987 and are used in small numbers by FSB (formerly KGB), MVD, OMON, GRU and Spetsnaz units. High price and limited quantity means it's being rarely deployed in Spetsnaz, and so it is also rarely seen. Of the two rifles, Vintorez was found to be more useful and can be seen more often in hands of Russian operatives. Val is used by some former Warsaw Pact countries, including Ukraine, so these rifles can be rarely found in The Zone. Some Mercenaries were also seen equipped with these weapons, which means that either Vals found their way to black market, or that Mercenaries are employed by Russian Federation. Stalkers like these rifles for their low weight and stealth fire capabilities, but heavy ammunition often makes it hard to carry a big amount of it on longer expeditions.

%c[0,170,170,170]Beretta 92 is a family of semi-automatic pistols designed in 1972 by Pietro Beretta Arms Factory in Italy. It is one of the most famous pistols today, being considered one of the "wonder nines" - a new generation of pistols chambered in 9x19mm round with double-stack magazine, like CZ-75, P226 and SW59. It became a choice of many police departments around the world, and most famously replaced the venerable M1911 as a service sidearm in US military. Mechanically the Beretta 92 is a short-recoil operated, locked-breech firearm with an aluminum frame. It was based on earlier Beretta designs, like M1951, which also used parts of Walther P38. It's biggest advantage is high-capacity magazine holding 15 rounds - back in 1970s most pistols still had capacity of 7-8 rounds. It has a good trigger and is easy to shoot, which improves practical accuracy, and is a reliable weapon when properly maintained. It has a chrome-lined barrel which protects the bore from rust and wear. Among it's drawbacks are heavy weight and big dimensions, which lower the ergonomics compared to modern, more compact pistols and the 92 can be hard to handle properly for people with smaller hands. However, the Beretta pistols are available in big numbers for relatively low price, which makes them popular among civilian gun owners and stalkers.

%c[0,170,170,170]This customized pistol has elongated accurized barrel, match trigger and a heavy recoil reducing spring installed. The frame and barrel seems to be a work of a fine gunsmith. Beretta 92 is a family of semi-automatic pistols designed in 1972 by Pietro Beretta Arms Factory in Italy. It is one of the most famous pistols today, being considered one of the "wonder nines" - a new generation of pistols chambered in 9x19mm round with double-stack magazine, like CZ-75, P226 and SW59. It became a choice of many police departments around the world, and most famously replaced the venerable M1911 as a service sidearm in US military. Mechanically the Beretta 92 is a short-recoil operated, locked-breech firearm with an aluminum frame. It was based on earlier Beretta designs, like M1951, which also used parts of Walther P38. It's biggest advantage is high-capacity magazine holding 15 rounds - back in 1970s most pistols still had capacity of 7-8 rounds. It has a good trigger and is easy to shoot, which improves practical accuracy, and is a reliable weapon when properly maintained. It has a chrome-lined barrel which protects the bore from rust and wear. Among it's drawbacks are heavy weight and big dimensions, which lower the ergonomics compared to modern, more compact pistols and the 92 can be hard to handle properly for people with smaller hands. However, the Beretta pistols are available in big numbers for relatively low price, which makes them popular among civilian gun owners and stalkers.

%c[0,170,170,170]The M7 bayonet is a bayonet that was used by the U.S. military for the M16 rifle, it can also be used with the M4 carbine as well as many other assault rifles, carbines and combat shotguns. It can be used as a fighting knife and utility tool. It was introduced in 1964, when the M16 rifle entered service during the Vietnam War. Under the current circumstances, the M7 bayonet can be used as a very effective knife for its pointy end and thin blade. A very good melee weapon against unarmored enemies and soft skinned mutants.

%c[0,170,170,170]The OKC-3S is a bayonet developed by the United States Marine Corps to replace the M7 bayonet and M9 bayonet as its service bayonet for the M16 family of rifles and M4 series carbine. This multipurpose bayonet provides greater durability than the M7 and also functions as a fighting knife. The OKC-3S is part of a series of weapon improvements begun in 2001 by Commandant of the Marine Corps James L. Jones to expand and toughen hand-to-hand combat training for Marines, including training in the Marine Corps Martial Arts Program and knife fighting. In the Multi-Purpose Bayonet program, 33 different knives were evaluated. The OKC-3S performed best, or next to best, in nearly all testing categories. A contract for OKC-3S was made in December 2002 and production and distribution began in January 2003.

%c[0,170,170,170]The Fairbairn–Sykes fighting knife is a double-edged fighting knife resembling a dagger or poignard with a foil grip developed by William Ewart Fairbairn and Eric Anthony Sykes in Shanghai based on concepts which the two men initiated before World War II while serving on the Shanghai Municipal Police in China. This design was made famous during World War II when issued to British Commandos, the Airborne Forces, the SAS and many other units, especially for the Normandy landings in June 1944. With its acutely tapered, sharply pointed blade, the F-S fighting knife is frequently described as a stiletto, a weapon optimised for thrusting, although the F-S knife is capable of being used to inflict slash cuts upon an opponent when its cutting edges are sharpened according to specification. The Wilkinson Sword Company made the knife with minor pommel and grip design variations. The F-S fighting knife was designed exclusively for surprise attack and fighting, with a slender blade that can easily penetrate a ribcage. The vase handle grants precise grip, and the blade's design is especially suited to its use as a fighting knife. The length of the blade was chosen to give several inches of blade to penetrate the body after passing through the 3 in (7.6 cm) of the thickest clothing that was anticipated to be worn in the war, namely that of Soviet greatcoats. Later production runs of the F-S fighting knife have a blade length that is about 7.5 in (19 cm). This weapon is one of the most effective melee weapons in existence, and a well executed thrust to the heart can make an enemy bleed out in about 2-5 seconds.

%c[0,170,170,170]PSO (for Pritsel Snaipersky Optichesky, "Optical Sniper Sight") is a series of Soviet-made optical scopes produced by Novosibirsk Instrument-Making Plant (NPZ Optics State Plant). In wide use since 1964 where it was introduced as a standard issue telescopic sight for SVD sniper rifle. The scope has been later adapted to assault rifles such as AK-74 or AN-94. Recognized for its durability, versatility and very well-designed reticle pattern featuring convenient range-finder scale. This particular type has been equipped with self-sustaining third generation night vision device and 2.6x magnification rate, making it ideal for close to medium range combat in low-light conditions. This variant was mainly designed for use by Spetsnaz units. It is attached to weapons by means of a dovetail mount. The scope's body is very durable, so it might be difficult to salvage batteries without damaging them.

%c[0,170,170,170]SUSAT is a weapon sighting system developed and widely used by the British Army during the Cold War, which has later been ported by numerous other Western-block countries and can now be installed on top of most modern rifles equipped with NATO-standard Picatinny rail. It features an atypical, pylon-shaped reticle which makes the sight usable mostly at short-medium distances due to the fact it can obscure targets at long range. This particular unit is equipped with third generation night-vision device, which indicates special-forces designation. The scope's body is very durable, so it might be difficult to salvage batteries without damaging them.

%c[0,170,170,170]Sako TRG is a bolt-action sniper rifle line designed and manufactured by the Finnish firearms manufacturer, SAKO. TRG-42 is a variant chambered in powerful .338 Lapua Magnum cartridge, which allows for accurate shooting on ranges well above 1500m. The TRG system is almost unique in being a purpose-designed sniper rifle, rather than an accurised version of an existing, general-purpose rifle. It uses standard SAKO bolt action, with rotating bolt having three massive lugs at the front. The heart of the TRG system is a cold-hammer forged receiver and barrel. Both provide maximum strength for minimum weight as well as excellent resistance to wear. The action has a hex style profile on top with a smaller closed ejection port. The bolt handle is the appropriate length and sports a large synthetic bulbous knob that provides a firm, positive grip. The receiver's large bedding surface is mated to an aluminium alloy-bedding block by three screws for maximum stability. This combination ensures an unusually high degree of stability. Free-floating, heavy, chrome moly barrels are used. Chrome moly barrels resist throat erosion better offering a longer accuracy life than stainless steel barrels. Two-stage match trigger, with very light pull weight (~1kg) can be adjusted for shooter's needs. The TRG stock design is besides sniping requirements, designed to conform to both UIT and CISM regulations. TRG rifles are popular among militaries, law enforcement agencies and civilian shooters and are by many considered one of the best sniper rifles currently available. TRG-42 rifles are used by special forces units from Finland, Norway, Switzerland and even Russia and Ukraine. In The Zone, TRG rifles are used by stalkers who brought them in or mercenaries. They are used to kill enemies in heavy body armor or to shoot dangerous mutants from long distances on which shooters themselves stay safe.

%c[0,170,170,170]Sako Rk95TP (also known as RK95 or M95) is a new, updated version of Rk62 - a Finnish assault rifle chambered in 7.62x39mm, which is essentially an AKM variant, redesigned and modified to be more reliable and resistant, especially in cold weather of Finnish mainland. These rifles were manufactured with excellent quality, which together with it's modifications make it widely considered to be the one of the best AK variants ever made. The differences from Rk62 are new, side folding stock, enlarged trigger guard, which allows to shoot with thick gloves on (very important in harsh Finnish winter), a new handguard with three venting slots and ability to easily adjust gas system. An efficient muzzle device is installed, which reduces recoil, muzzle flash and allows shooting rifle grenades. Additionally it can use underbarrel rifle grenades. All the rest is the same as in Rk62 rifle. Mechanically, Rk62 is basically the same as AKM, but it has a lot of external changes to it, like different stock and handguard, precision sights installed and new muzzle device. Rk95's manufacturing process is held to highest standards and these Finnish rifles have the highest material and finish quality of all AK variants. Internals works just as any other AK rifle - it's a gas operated, selective fire weapon. The gas operated action has a massive bolt carrier with a permanently attached long stroke gas piston. The bolt carrier moves on the two rails with visible clearances between the parts, which allows the gun to operate even when it's interior is severely fouled with sand or mud. Some of these rifles were sold to Libya, from where they were acquired and sold on black market, finally reaching The Zone, where they are very sought after for their high reliability in the harsh conditions.

%c[0,170,170,170]Rk62 (also known as Sako/Valmet Rk62, 7.62 RK62 or M62) is a Finnish assault rifle chambered in 7.62x39mm, which is essentially an AKM variant, redesigned and modified to be more reliable and resistant, especially in cold weather of Finnish mainland. These rifles were manufactured with excellent quality, which together with it's modifications make it widely considered to be the one of the best AK variants ever made. Rk62 was a base for development another great AK variant with even higher reliability - the Israeli Galil. Rk62 was designed jointly by Valmet and Sako in 1962 using Polish AKM variant as base. Mechanically, Rk62 is basically the same as AKM, but it has a lot of external changes to it. It has redesigned, tubular stock, which is very durable. Rear sight was moved to rear of the receiver cover and front sight was moved on top of gas tube, which makes it harder to bend or damage. The change also made the sight line almost twice as long, which significantly improved practical accuracy. Another modification is a new, three-prong flash hider, similar to that on M16A1 rifles, which greatly reduces the muzzle flash. Whole weapon manufacturing process is held to highest standards and these Finnish rifles have the highest material and finish quality of all AK variants. Internals works just as any other AK rifle - it's a gas operated, selective fire weapon. The gas operated action has a massive bolt carrier with a permanently attached long stroke gas piston. The bolt carrier moves on the two rails with visible clearances between the parts, which allows the gun to operate even when it's interior is severely fouled with sand or mud. Some of these rifles were sold to Libya, from where they were acquired and sold on black market, finally reaching The Zone, where they are very sought after for their high reliability in the harsh conditions.

%c[0,170,170,170]The Steyr AUG is an Austrian 5.56x45mm assault rifle. It was one of the first successful rifles built in bullpup configuration and is one of the most famously known rifles in the world thanks to it's unique design and high effectiveness. It has became the service rifle of the Austrian army in 1978 and since then it has been adopted by more than 30 countries, among them Ireland, Australia, New Zealand and Uruguay. Mechanically, the AUG is a gas operated firearm using a short piston stroke principle. It combined multiple then-revolutionary ideas, among them a telescopic sight mounted by default, a quick-changeable barrel which can be replaced in few seconds, a fiberglass-reinforced polyamide housing which seals the internals off from outside elements while lowering the weight and of course the bullpup layout, which allows for long barrel, which improves velocity of 5.56mm bullet, to be used while remaining compact and ergonomic. It also has a front grip and a recoil compensator (which also works as flash hider), which lowers the muzzle rise and improves the controllability of the rifle. All parts of the rifle are made with highest quality materials using fine manufacturing. Multiple variants of AUG were produced. Apart from standard rifle, there was also short-barrel carbine, an SMG and heavy-barrel LMG; additionally, countries like Australia made their own modernized variants. Overally, the Steyr AUG is a very well made rifle which has multiple clever solutions combines into one package. Some of these rifles reached The Zone through the black market and are also used by PMCs. AUGs are rare and relatively expensive, but their high reliability, accuracy and very good ergonomics mean it's a rifle that is sought after by lots of stalkers.

%c[0,170,170,170]Based on the AUG, Steyr developed the 9mm AUG submachine gun variant. It is an automatic, blowback-operated model that fires from a closed bolt, and is chambered in 9?19mm Parabellum cartridge. Unlike the rifle variants, it has a unique 420 mm (16.5 in) barrel with six right-hand grooves at a 250 mm (1:9.8 in) rifling twist rate, ended with a recoil compensator, a slightly different charging handle and a magazine well conversion insert enabling the use of standard 25-round box magazines from the Steyr MPi 81 and TMP submachine guns. A conversion kit used to transform any assault rifle configuration into the submachine gun configuration is also available. The conversion kit consists of a barrel, bolt, adapter insert and magazine. The Steyr AUG Para also known as the AUG SMG or AUG 9mm is chambered in 9?19mm Parabellum cartridge and has been produced since 1988.[1] It differs from the A1 model by the barrel, bolt, magazine and a magazine well adapter, which allows the rifle to feed from Steyr MPi 69 magazines. This variant operates as a blowback firearm, without the use of the rifle's gas system.[16] For some time a kit of the above components was available to convert any AUG into a 9mm variant. AUGs are rare and relatively expensive, but their high reliability, accuracy and very good ergonomics mean it's a rifle that is sought after by lots of stalkers.

%c[0,170,170,170]A modified version of the well-known Dragunov sniper rifle. Muzzle and barrel were manufactured with the use of advanced machining processes resulting in improved accuracy and increased effective range of the gun (exceeding 800 meters). This design is intended for specialized sniper teams and for this purpose features a ghillie camouflage allowing the user to blend in with the environment and sneak up behind unsuspecting targets. Best used together with the ghillie suit in order to achieve maximum concealing effectiveness.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]ATTACHMENTS:
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] POSP 4x24 M scope (permanent)

%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Main characteristic and advantages: %c[0,170,170,170]Low ammo capacity. High power. Very high reliability - the cylinder doesn't jam unless seriously damaged. %c[0,140,140,140] 
 
%c[0,170,170,170]MP-412 REX is a Russian double-action/single-action revolver designed by the state-owned Izhevsk Mechanical Plant, with a break-action chamber and an automatic ejector, chambered for the .357 Magnum round. The MP-412 is a double action revolver with a break-open frame and simultaneous extraction. The bottom frame is a composite type – it consists of a steel basic frame and a polymer envelope, which forms the grip and trigger guard. Polymer grip/trigger guard unit can be removed from the steel frame if necessary. The trigger is a conventional type, double action/single action, with exposed hammer. The firing pin is mounted in the frame. The barrel/cylinder group latch is located at the top rear of the frame, and is operated by two buttons that must be pushed inwards to unlock the frame. The cylinder holds 6 rounds and has an automatic ejector that throws the cases out of the cylinder once the barrel is fully tipped down. If necessary, the automatic ejection feature can be manually switched off. Only about a hundred of these revolvers were manufactured, since US banned the import of Russian firearms, the IzhMash lost their primary market. Some of them were sold to civilian owners in Europe and small number of these revolvers reached The Zone, where they are extremely rare. .357 Magnum revolvers, together with MP-412, are a popular sidearm in areas with high activity of wild animals, such as Alaska or Ukrainian Exclusion Zone.

\n \n%c[0,170,170,170]An axe (or ax) is an implement that has been used for millennia to shape, split and cut wood; to harvest timber; as a weapon; and as a ceremonial or heraldic symbol. The axe has many forms and specialised uses but generally consists of an axe head with a handle, or helve. In the zone, the axe can mean life or death.

\n \n%c[0,170,170,170]Shovels are used as useful tools for gardening or entrenching, but can also be really dangerous when the blade is sharpened. Russian army was famous for using military shovels sharp as knives against trench raiders.

\n \n%c[0,170,170,170]Clubbing weapons are probably as old as the humanity itself. Since the human skulls didn't evolve to get thicker, wooden or metal bats are just as effective in crushing them as they were fifty thousand years ago.

\n \n%c[0,170,170,170]A very reliable and virtually indestructible tool. Perfect for dismantling weapons, some helmets and various electronic devices. It can also be of assist for outfit repairs and weapon maintenance. Due to its versatility some stalkers appreciate keeping it in their backpacks in spite of its heavy weight. A common find in industrial and urban areas of the Zone.

%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Main characteristic and advantages: %c[0,170,170,170]Designed for maximum reliability. Moderate recoil. Can place follow-up shots reliably. Good damage output. Best on close and medium range. %c[0,140,140,140] 
 
%c[0,170,170,170]AK ("Avtomat Kalashnikova", Kalashnikov's Automatic Rifle) is a Soviet assault rifle chambered in 7.62x39mm M43 cartridge, designed and developed by Mikhail Kalashnikov as a replacement for old rifles and submachine guns. It went on to become the most famous assault rifle ever designed, serving in many countries with more than 100 million units made. Mechanically, it's a gas operated, selective fire assault rifle. The gas operated action has a massive bolt carrier with a permanently attached long stroke gas piston. The bolt carrier moves on the two rails with visible clearances between the parts, which allows the gun to operate even when it's interior is severely fouled with sand or mud. Overengineered receiver and chrome lined barrel provide exceptional durability, and the well-designed cartridge dimensions and strong action allow for reliable feeding in almost all conditions, even when the weapon is very dirty and/or corroded. Due to it's great balance of firepower, accuracy, reliability and low price, the AK-47 is often considered the "gold standard" and a point of reference among assault rifles. It is reliable, easy to produce, easy to operate and very effective. First AKs were produced in 1949, and until today, more than 100 million AKs of all kinds were manufactured, with AK-47 and it's variants making up about 75% of them. AK's strongest sides are it's heavy firepower and reliability under all conditions, even if the weapon is heavily worn out. Among it's disadvantages are it's relatively heavy weight (in comparison to more modern rifles), susceptibility to catching dirt and dust (it's not sealed from outside elements) and average accuracy in comparison with M16. In The Zone, old AKs are sometimes found on black market and are commonly used by stalkers, just like newer AKM rifles. AKs are well liked for their very high reliability and firepower, and it's powerful 7.62mm round makes it more effective against wild animals and mutants than comparable 5.45x39mm and 5.56x45mm chambered rifles.

%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Main characteristic and advantages: %c[0,170,170,170]Designed for maximum reliability. Moderate recoil. Can place follow-up shots reliably. Good damage output. Best on close and medium range. %c[0,140,140,140] 
 
%c[0,170,170,170]AKMS is a modernized, folding-stock variant of AKM rifle, a Soviet assault rifle chambered in 7.62x39mm M43 cartridge, designed and developed by Mikhail Kalashnikov as a replacement for old rifles and submachine guns, which went on to become the most famous assault rifle ever designed, serving in many countries with more than 100 million units made. Mechanically, it's a gas operated, selective fire assault rifle. The gas operated action has a massive bolt carrier with a permanently attached long stroke gas piston. The bolt carrier moves on the two rails with visible clearances between the parts, which allows the gun to operate even when it's interior is severely fouled with sand or mud. Overengineered receiver and chrome lined barrel provide exceptional durability, and the well-designed cartridge dimensions and strong action allow for reliable feeding in almost all conditions, even when the weapon is very dirty and/or corroded. Due to it's great balance of firepower, accuracy, reliability and low price, the AK is often considered the "gold standard" and a point of reference among assault rifles. AKM has many improvements over first AK-47s, biggest ones being stamped receiver, which reduced weight by nearly 1 kilogram compared to milled receiver AK, new barrel mount type that improves accuracy and straight buttstock made of plywood, which reduces felt recoil and is more resistant than old-type stock made from one part of wood. All these changes make AKM even more effective weapon than original AK-47. However, it still has it's drawbacks, such as still subpar accuracy when compared to newer designs, use of corrosive ammunition which is harsh on internals and finally ergonomics which are average at best. In The Zone the AKMS rifles are very common since it's one of Ukrainian military rifles and a lot of them were stolen from warehouses or bought from corrupt military officials. They are well liked for their very high reliability, folding stock and firepower, and it's powerful 7.62mm round makes it more effective against wild animals and mutants than comparable 5.45x39mm and 5.56x45mm chambered rifles.

%c[0,170,170,170]The AKM (literally translated "Kalashnikov modernized automatic rifle") is an upgraded version of the AK-47 rifle. Although it was replaced in Soviet front-line service by the AK-74 in the 1970s, the AKM is the most widely used variant of the AK series of firearms. A special camouflage was applied to the rifle in order to represent the Freedom faction.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]ATTACHMENTS:
 
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] 7.62x39 compatible silencer
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] PSO series scopes (after modification)
%c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] GP-25 grenade launcher

%c[0,170,170,170]The AKM (literally translated "Kalashnikov modernized automatic rifle") is an upgraded version of the AK-47 rifle. Although it was replaced in Soviet front-line service by the AK-74 in the 1970s, the AKM is the most widely used variant of the AK series of firearms. This particular weapon belongs to the Duty faction.
